jobs.title: Marketing & Player Acquisition Manager H/F
jobs.description:
Job Description

Already the market leader in UGC games in France (Minecraft), Rivrs aims to become a global leader in UGC studios (Minecraft, Roblox, Fortnite, GTA, and more). Our ambitious plans include opening international branches (USA/Canada, Germany), developing our own IPs on existing and upcoming UGC platforms (Hytale, GTA, and more), acquiring independent studios worldwide, and expanding into licensing and merchandising.

As the Marketing Manager at Rivrs, a UGC-focused video game studio, you will be responsible for driving an effective player acquisition strategy across multiple channels. You will manage and implement a creative acquisition strategy using both organic and paid channels, focusing on long-term growth in key markets (FR/US). You‚Äôll work closely with influencers, content creators, and internal teams to ensure Rivrs reaches and engages its target audience effectively.

Key Responsibilities

Acquisition Strategy & Campaign Management:

Develop and execute a creative player acquisition strategy using both organic and paid advertising methods.Manage advertising campaigns across multiple platforms (e.g., TikTok, Snapchat, Instagram) ensuring optimization and effective use of resources.Propose and implement innovative strategies to improve player acquisition and drive user growth.

Influencer Strategy & Collaboration:

Build and manage a long-term influencer strategy for the FR/US markets.Source, negotiate, and manage contracts with influencers and content creators, ensuring alignment with brand and marketing goals.Monitor and report on the performance and results of influencer collaborations.

Content Creator Engagement:

Develop strong relationships with content creators to promote organic growth through user-generated content.Oversee content collaboration projects, ensuring they align with broader marketing goals and community engagement strategies.

Community Engagement & Growth:

Create and implement strategies to boost engagement with the existing community, with a focus on fostering loyalty and leveraging it to acquire new players.Monitor community trends and behavior to adapt marketing tactics for optimal engagement and player retention.

Reporting & Analysis:

Regularly track and analyze the performance of marketing campaigns, influencer partnerships, and community engagement strategies.Provide detailed reports to stakeholders, highlighting key insights and recommendations for future marketing efforts.

Requirements

Experience:

3+ years of experience in marketing or player acquisition within the gaming industry, preferably in a UGC-driven environment.Proven track record of managing successful digital marketing campaigns across multiple platforms.Experience working with influencers and content creators, including contract negotiation and performance analysis.

Skills:

Strong understanding of player acquisition strategies, both organic and paid, with a creative approach to campaign execution.Excellent communication and negotiation skills, particularly with influencers and external partners.Proficiency in performance tracking tools and analytics software.

Preferred:

Experience working in the UGC or gaming industry with a focus on community-driven content.Knowledge of current trends in social media marketing and influencer strategies.

3+ years of experience in marketing or player acquisition within the gaming industry, preferably in a UGC-driven environment.Proven track record of managing successful digital marketing campaigns across multiple platforms.Experience working with influencers and content creators, including contract negotiation and performance analysis.

Skills:

Strong understanding of player acquisition strategies, both organic and paid, with a creative approach to campaign execution.Excellent communication and negotiation skills, particularly with influencers and external partners.Proficiency in performance tracking tools and analytics software.

Preferred:

Experience working in the UGC or gaming industry with a focus on community-driven content.Knowledge of current trends in social media marketing and influencer strategies.

jobs.title: Product & Marketing Lead
jobs.description:
At CulturePulse, we are at the forefront of leveraging AI to transform complex decision-making processes. Our flagship AI technology, ARES, is engineered to revolutionize how diverse sectors approach critical business and research challenges. CulturePulse‚Äôs simulations are used by organizations to inform policy, counter misinformation, and design technology with societal impact.
Job OverviewPassionate about both product strategy and growth? We‚Äôre looking for a Product & Marketing Lead to drive product discovery, manage agile delivery, and lead top-of-funnel customer acquisition across our B2B and B2G markets.
In this role, you‚Äôll work closely with our founders and engineers to shape the product roadmap, drive lean sprints, and craft outreach strategies that attract and convert high-quality leads.
What you will do:Lead product discovery, validation, and prototyping.Manage product sprints, retrospectives, and backlog prioritisation.Design, test, and implement inbound and outbound lead generation strategies.Build targeted campaigns via email, LinkedIn, events, and partnerships.Collaborate with marketing and sales to optimise lead nurturing, conversion, and create impactful sales assets.Champion a lean, iterative development process aligned with organisational goals.
What you will bring:Proven product management experience (discovery through delivery).Experience in B2B/B2G lead generation, digital outreach, and relationship-based growth.Excellent communication and organisational skills.A growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to work autonomously.
Nice to have:B2B/B2G lead generation expertise (digital + relationship-driven)Experience in growth, BD, or partnerships alongside product leadershipKnowledge of public sector procurement/sales cycles (UK, EU, NATO)Background in UX/UI designFamiliarity with product architecture & software development
What we offer:You‚Äôll be part of a mission-driven team building technology with real societal impact. Working across government, private sector, and non-profit partners, you‚Äôll gain exposure to diverse challenges while shaping products that matter. We offer the freedom of a fully remote role, the energy of an early-stage environment, and the opportunity to collaborate with smart, purpose-driven colleagues.
If this sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Marketing & External Communication Manager
jobs.description:
Marketing & External Communication Manager
ABOUT Dylogyüìç Location: Lyon, France (Hybrid / Partial Remote ‚Äì EU only)üåê Company: At Dylogy, we‚Äôre not just another tech company. We‚Äôre on the cusp of changing the (re)insurance market with our groundbreaking Risk monitoring AI platform. If you‚Äôre a change-maker, passionate about AI, and eager to reshape the way insurance works, you‚Äôre the candidate we‚Äôve been searching for

JOB DETAILSüïí Contract: Permanent (CDI) ‚Äì Full-timeüîó Reports to: CEO (close collaboration with Product & Sales leadership)üåç Role: Marketing & External Communication Managerüí∞ Salary: 55-65K‚Ç¨

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Marketing (60%)o Product Marketing & Positioning: Define Dylogy‚Äôs value proposition, personas, and use cases. Craft compelling product narratives for new features and solutions.o Go-to-Market Strategy: Build and execute launch plans, lead generation campaigns, and marketing playbooks aligned with sales objectives.o Digital Marketing & Automation:¬ß Own and optimize Dylogy‚Äôs website (analytics, conversion tracking).¬ß Deploy marketing automation (Hubspot).¬ß Manage targeted email campaigns, nurture flows, and lead scoring.o Sales Enablement: Provide high-quality marketing collateral (decks, one-pagers, case studies). Collaborate with sales teams to align messaging and accelerate deal cycles.
External Communication (30%)o Content Creation & Brand Voice: Produce engaging and consistent content (articles, brochures, white papers, thought-leadership pieces, product videos).o Digital & Social Media: Lead Dylogy‚Äôs online presence across LinkedIn, X, YouTube, etc. Manage editorial calendar and community engagement.o Events & Industry Presence: Coordinate Dylogy‚Äôs participation in major industry conferences, webinars, and partner events.o Thought Leadership: Position Dylogy as a trusted voice in AI, insurance, and risk monitoring through speaking opportunities, publications, and strategic content.o Generative AI Tools: Leverage cutting-edge tools (ChatGPT, MidJourney, etc.) to accelerate content creation and enhance creativity.

jobs.title: Consultant, Digital Strategy
jobs.description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Practice Area

BCG‚Äôs Tech and Digital practice area focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. Tech and Digital is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including Digital Transformation, Data & Digital Platforms, AI at Scale, Agile, Cybersecurity and Digitizing the Tech Function. Our Tech and Digital offer encompasses tech experts across BCG and Platinion, providing seamless multidisciplinary solutions to our clients.

What You'll Do

Our world is being driven by digital and at BCG we are at the heart of it. In DigitalBCG, you would use your expertise and generalist consulting skillset to help CEOs and their teams solve their most pressing challenges, and think about how digital and technology will change the shape of their business.You would help your clients answer questions such as 'How will AI disrupt my business model?', 'How can businesses use data and analytics to create highly-personalized outreach delivered through a seamless omnichannel experience?', 'How can I ship higher quality digital services to my customers faster by using agile?' and much more.As a member of our team, you would work on a variety of these topics, applying your consulting skills to strategic digital, technology, and digital transformation questions.As a DigitalBCG Consultant, you will be given end-to-end responsibility for the larger and more complex 'modules' within a BCG project, and begin to develop specialized knowledge to help you solve our clients' problems. You'll work closely with clients to understand their issues, create strategies for change, win buy-in for your recommendations, and collaborate with fellow BCGers to transform client potential into performance.A broad skillset and passion for digital & technology is important. As part of our digitally-focused consulting team, you would work on a variety of digital topics, applying generalist consulting skills to strategic digital & technology questions. You will be supported by an extensive training curriculum (the same programme as all BCG consultants), plus digital-specific training and mentoring to help you build your skills.

What You'll Bring

We're looking for exceptional talent from consulting or industry to join us. You would typically:

Have 4-6 years' of experience working:with a leading consulting firm (focused on technology/digital initiatives)in a corporate role focused on technology/digital initiatives (e.g. business analyst)in a tech start-up leadership role or in a 'consulting-like' industry (e.g. digital strategy, digital marketing)Have an outstanding academic track record from a leading universityHave excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Who You'll Work With

Who You'll Work With:Our consultants within DigitalBCG are an integral part of BCG's core consulting team; we work side-by-side with all practice areas to create value & competitive advantage for our clients

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here  for more information on E-Verify.

jobs.title: Technical SEO Manager - relocation to Cyprus
jobs.description:
We are looking for a highly skilled SEO Expert with proven experience in the iGaming industry to join our team. This role requires deep technical expertise, a strong understanding of complex web environments, and a track record of driving measurable organic growth. The ideal candidate will combine hands-on technical SEO knowledge with the ability to create clear implementation roadmaps for development teams.
This is an on-site in Limassol. We will be happy to relocate you!
Key Responsibilities:Lead SEO strategy and execution for iGaming products across multiple marketsConduct ongoing technical SEO audits, identifying issues and delivering clear, actionable instructions to development teamsManage SEO optimization for JavaScript-based websites, including working with prerender service to ensure proper crawlability and indexationDevelop and oversee site speed optimization initiatives, providing precise recommendations to developersPlan and manage complex site migration projects to protect and enhance search engine visibilityDefine and maintain a long-term SEO roadmap for web products, ensuring sustainable organic growth and visibilityTrack performance, analyze data, and report insights using tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Ahrefs, SEMrush, and Screaming FrogStay ahead of search engine algorithm changes and emerging AI-driven search and AI agent optimization trendsCollaborate closely with product, content, and developer teams to ensure SEO is embedded into all stages of development
Requirements:4+ years SEO experience within the iGaming industry (mandatory)Strong expertise in JavaScript SEO and handling websites that rely on client-side renderingHands-on experience with prerender service and dynamic rendering solutionsProven ability to run ongoing technical audits and translate findings into clear developer instructionsDemonstrated experience improving site performance and speed through structured collaboration with developersTrack record of successfully handling complex website migrations with minimal loss of visibilityStrong knowledge of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and modern SEO best practicesProven success in optimizing for AI agents and preparing websites for emerging search technologiesiProficiency with SEO tools: Google Analytics, GSC, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, Screaming Frog, etsSolid understanding of HTML, CSS, and CMS platformsExcellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly document SEO requirements and roadmaps for non-SEO stakeholders

jobs.title: Content Writer
jobs.description:
Innodata (NASDAQ: INOD) is a leading data engineering company. With more than 2,000 customers and operations in 13 cities around the world, we are an AI technology solutions provider-of-choice for 4 out of 5 of the world‚Äôs biggest technology companies, as well as leading companies across financial services, insurance, technology, law, and medicine.By combining advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence (ML/AI) technologies, a global workforce of subject matter experts, and a high-security infrastructure, we‚Äôre helping usher in the promise of AI. Innodata offers a powerful combination of both digital data solutions and easy-to-use, high-quality platforms.
Our global workforce includes over 5,000 employees in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, the Philippines, India, Sri Lanka, Israel and Germany.
About the role:
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented linguist to support AI training initiatives and linguistic content creation. This role is ideal for someone with a strong academic background in linguistics (syntax, semantics, pragmatics, morphology, phonology, sociolinguistics, etc.) and a passion for language, technology, and clear communication. You will play a crucial role in shaping the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) and NLP-based systems through high-quality linguistic data curation, annotation, and evaluation.
Job Title: Linguistics Expert ‚Äì AI Training & Content Writing

Key Responsibilities:
Create or edit linguistically- rich content including grammar guides, syntactic analyses, usage explanations, or examples for NLP pipelines.Identify and resolve issues related to ambiguity, bias, and grammaticality.Perform quality assurance (QA) on model outputs for fluency, tone, factual accuracy, and language appropriateness.Annotate linguistic datasets with syntactic, semantic, or pragmatic labels.Support internal teams by conducting linguistic research and summarizing findings.Apply linguistic knowledge to evaluate model behavior, error patterns, and generalization issues.
Qualifications:Deep understanding of linguistic theory and language structure.Experience with one or more of the following is a plus: computational linguistics, corpus analysis, language data annotation, LLM training.Strong writing, editing, and communication skills.
Next StepsTo proceed further in the evaluation process, you will need to complete two assessments:Assessment TestEvaluates your linguistic and analytical skillsLink: https://icap.innodata.com/registerfreelancer?enc=oUTZVsr/Pnz/0Xygc2EK32MdtinqnjC9vy8RU3Ha4EOAPwT2LJJQDD68MkY6jszYhhsYYecqmKWja8eKXV801gezikielezikiel

Versant English Proficiency TestFocuses on assessing your spoken and written English proficiencyA C1 or C2 level is required to qualify
Once both assessments are successfully completed, you will be eligible for onboarding.Arabic Language test
Action Required: XConnect RegistrationYou will also receive an invitation to our internal job platform, XConnect. Please take a few minutes to register and complete your profile. All project onboarding, communication, and documentation are managed through this platform.
If interested, kindly share your resume at: rranjan2@innodata.com

Versant English Proficiency TestFocuses on assessing your spoken and written English proficiencyA C1 or C2 level is required to qualify
Once both assessments are successfully completed, you will be eligible for onboarding.Arabic Language test
Action Required: XConnect RegistrationYou will also receive an invitation to our internal job platform, XConnect. Please take a few minutes to register and complete your profile. All project onboarding, communication, and documentation are managed through this platform.
If interested, kindly share your resume at: rranjan2@innodata.com

jobs.title: Operations Specialist ‚Äì Marketplace
jobs.description:
We‚Äôre looking for an analytical and solutions-driven Operations Specialist with excellent leadership and interpersonal skills to help us grow our ride-hailing operations in France. The Operations Specialist will play a pivotal role within the Marketplace Team at Bolt, supporting various aspects of our marketplace operations.

Please note that this is a full-time permanent employment opportunity.

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 100 million customers in 45+ countries. We‚Äôre a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission ‚Äì to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

As an Operations Specialist you will have a direct and tangible impact on local operations that you can see in real-time. If you‚Äôre ready to take full ownership of your work, disrupt the marketplace, and shape movement patterns in the urban landscape - here‚Äôs your chance!

You will be leading local operations projects and working closely with other cross-functional/HQ stakeholders to support our mission to make cities more sustainable, accessible and affordable.

Your daily adventures will include:

Conducting performance audits across our marketplace in various cities.Formulating actionable recommendations to enhance marketplace performance.Analyzing pricing strategies and suggesting price adjustments as needed.Collaborating closely with central teams to implement demand and supply campaigns effectively.Providing analytical and data support to city managers to facilitate informed decision-making..


About you:

Strong analytical skills paired with a relentless curiosity, willing to delve deep into data to identify root causes.You are a strong leader and collaborator with excellent negotiation and communication skills (both verbal and written) in English and French.Organized and methodical approach to problem-solving within our marketplace.Pragmatic mindset, prioritizing effective solutions over unnecessarily complex ones.Collaborative team player, capable of working efficiently with diverse stakeholders.Proficiency in SQL and automation is a big plus.


Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you‚Äôre the kind of person described above!

Why you‚Äôll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility. Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries. Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world. Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities. Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work. Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode. Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks. Some perks may differ depending on your location.

jobs.title: Growth Marketing Specialist
jobs.description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesOwn. Take full ownership of your product‚Äôs marketing strategy. You‚Äôll lead user acquisition end-to-end, from setting goals to launching campaigns and scaling what works to maximize performance.Create. Generate new ad concepts and out-of-the-box growth-hacking ideas, formulate testable hypotheses, coordinate implementation across channels like Google, Meta, and TikTok, and provide sharp feedback to continuously raise the bar.Analyze. Monitor performance through BI dashboards and campaign data. Ensure acquisition efforts achieve target KPIs, and turn insights into bold, data-driven decisions that fuel growth.Collaborate. Work closely with the product team to understand user motivations and help shape monetization and growth strategies that align with user behavior and long-term success.

What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager (Crypto)
jobs.description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

If Revolut is a rocket ship ‚Äî and we like to think it is ‚Äî best-in-class creativity is what propels us past the competition in the eyes of our customers. Working with Marketing, Product, Analytics, and just about any other team you can think of, our superstar Marketing Managers lead the development of jaw-dropping content and campaign strategies that demonstrate how beneficial Revolut is to millions of people.

We're looking for a #GetItDone creative genius to join the team and take the lead on bringing our #NeverSettle propositions to market as a Marketing Manager for Crypto. You'll have an exciting opportunity to work closely with the local management team as well as the global function lead to drive growth in the market.

Up for the challenge? Let‚Äòs get in touch.

What You'll Be Doing

Identifying customer needs by understanding their behaviour and how our features work globally to create data-driven content to drive conversionDriving independently impactful go-to-market product launches by owning development of audience strategy, messaging, and communication strategiesDeveloping research plans to uncover customer insights, steer and validate product and marketing roadmaps, and stay on top of the competitive landscapeCreating market-leading campaign calendars designed to drive engagement across the entire funnel, from acquisition to retentionOwning tone of voice and style guides, adapting global campaigns aligned to local nuancesRunning experiments to test hypotheses and bring analytical rigour to campaigns for informing the go-to-market strategyDelivering campaigns with a solid bias for growth and business impactScaling creative marketing efforts globally by operationalising resources, such as playbooks for regional marketing teams

What You'll Need

Fluency in English (native level)5+ years of B2C marketing experience in a fast-paced environment (preferably a hyper-growth global tech company)Interest in the Crypto industryExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsPassion for Revolut‚Äôs products and featuresKnowledge of markets and the competitive landscape in the fintech or payments industryExtensive experience developing stories and compelling content to drive conversionExperience setting strategic direction and project managing complex campaigns that require input and execution from cross-functional teamsAn impressive track record of planning and creating editorial and commercial contentThe ability to analyse and distil data into actionable insights and to inform campaign strategy and product developmentTo be a charismatic people-person with the ability to talk to anyone and work in an evolving, growth environment

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

jobs.title: Global senior Social Media Manager - BeReal
jobs.description:
About BeReal

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 70+ and have 40M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

We‚Äôre looking for a creative, independent, and strategic Senior Social Media Manager to reactivate and reinvent BeReal‚Äôs presence on all global social platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and yes ‚Äî even BeReal itself.

You‚Äôll own BeReal‚Äôs voice across platforms, rekindle engagement with our millions of followers, and create content that feels human, on trend, and on brand. From lo-fi check-ins to thumb-stopping creative to strategic collabs, you‚Äôll help shape what BeReal means to this next generation ‚Äî especially as we expand into monetization.

Lead BeReal‚Äôs owned social media presence across TikTok, Instagram, and BeReal, with the potential to expand to emerging platformsReignite community engagement with creative, raw, and resonant content that reflects BeReal‚Äôs values: authenticity, mental health, and presenceDesign and own the content calendar, from planned storytelling to real-time reactive postsShape the voice and tone of BeReal across all platforms, reinforcing our distinct POV in the social landscapeCollaborate with our community to elevate user stories and content (UGC), and amplify our most passionate voicesPartner with the Brand Strategy team to roll out campaigns that support growth, brand trust, and cultural relevance ‚Äî particularly as we introduce adsTrack and analyze performance to inform strategy and optimize for engagement, reach, and resonanceEnsure alignment with overall brand strategy and comms priorities

Profile

5+ years experience managing social media for a youth-focused, culture-first brand or platform on a global scale (ideally EMEA + USA)Deep understanding of Gen Z behavior, trends, memes, and what it takes to earn attention (and trust)Strong creative instincts and impeccable taste ‚Äî you know what feels right, and what doesn‚ÄôtProven ability to grow and engage large audiences across platformsConfidence to work autonomously and take creative risks, with a test-learn-optimize mindsetExcellent writing and visual storytelling skills (bonus if you can shoot/edit content too)Passionate about authenticity, mental health, and building a better version of social mediaParis based

jobs.description:

Were a fast-growing team united by a mission: helping people unlock their full potential.

jobs.title: Marketing Director
jobs.description:
Job Location: Open to candidates from anywhere in the EU or the UKFlexibility: Option to work remotely
Why apply?Marketing at GraphAware is about more than promoting an innovative software product. It is an opportunity to help reshape how intelligence analysts accomplish their mission in an increasingly connected world. Our goal is to lead a shift in thinking across the intelligence community towards graph-centric analysis as a foundation for better decisions.
As Marketing Director, you will play a central role in advancing this vision. You will lead global marketing with a primary focus on "Five Eyes", EU, and NATO countries. Your work will help government agencies understand the value of our technology, as well as the importance of adopting a new approach to analysis based on relationships, context, and connected data.
You‚Äôll be joining a focused, driven team where ideas move quickly and impact is visible. There‚Äôs real room to shape the work, take ownership, and grow in a way that‚Äôs meaningful to you.
Your MissionAs Marketing Director, you will shape the core marketing strategy of GraphAware and GraphAware Hume, our connected data analytics platform.
Key ResponsibilitiesMarketing strategy: Understand the company‚Äôs strategy. Design the marketing strategy and plan. Execute it effectively, and translate it into clear team focus and priorities.Brand building and awareness: Build a brand that aligns with our long-term goals through strong strategy, planning, and execution. Act as a guardian of consistent messaging and representation of who we are across all channels. Maintain a strong public profile that reassures the market we are the right partner.Content and thought leadership: Develop clear, high-quality content that speaks directly to our audience and reflects a deep understanding of their challenges. Position the company as a credible voice in our field - insightful, practical, and worth listening to.Lead Generation: Set up the funnel and the overall measurement and evaluation system, including key metrics. Drive inbound lead generation by creating and promoting high-quality content. Assess the role outbound should play in our go-to-market approach.Sales support and partner management: Support the sales team by developing high-quality assets that communicate our value and align with our branding. Define and implement a practical approach to equip partners with the right messaging, tools, and materials to help them sell effectively.Events and webinars: Own and maintain a strong, up-to-date events and webinars calendar that supports our goals. Ensure every event is well-organized, high-quality, and delivers clear value to our audience.Team leadership: Provide clear focus and priorities for the team, grow its capabilities, and establish marketing as a strong, strategic function within the company.
Profile We Have in MindYou combine strong communication, structured thinking and a hands-on mindset, with the ability to align strategic vision and day-to-day execution.10‚Äì15 years of marketing experience, with at least 5‚Äì8 years leading full marketing efforts in a B2B software or SaaS companyA stable track record, including at least one or two roles held for 4+ yearsExperience in fast-growing software businesses with international reachExperience with complex, high-value solutions sold to enterprise or public sector clientsSkilled at building and leading a small marketing team with global focusProven brand builder with strong content strategy and thought leadership focus, including developing strategic, high-quality assets to support sales and partner teamsStrong grasp of lead generation, marketing funnels and performance metricsFluent English, spoken and written, at a near-native levelBonus: experience in intelligence technology or public sector software and long sales cycles
What We OfferUnique opportunity: Join us on our journey to fundamentally change the way intelligence analysis is conducted and to empower democratic government agenciesDriven and motivating environment: Striving for excellence is who we are but we‚Äôve always got each other‚Äôs back. Work in an environment that motivates and supports youSelf-realisation and autonomy: Thrive in an environment where autonomy is balanced with accountability. If something isn‚Äôt working, we take actionCompetitive compensation: Enjoy a competitive compensation package with a variable component and regular reviewsEquity participation: Share in the company's success through our share scheme program
GraphAware‚Äôs core valuesSense of OwnershipStrive for ExcellenceDriven by Customer SuccessBelief in the Value of GraphsI Got Your Back!
Ready to make an impact? Join GraphAware and be part of something truly transformative. Apply now and help shape the future of graph analytics!

jobs.title: Influencer Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
About usWallester is a cutting-edge financial technology company that specializes in providing innovative solutions for businesses seeking to modernize their payment systems. By offering white-label card issuance platforms, seamless integration with existing infrastructure, and comprehensive support for both digital and physical cards, Wallester empowers companies to enhance their financial services and customer experience. Recognized as a leader in the FinTech space, Wallester has earned a reputation for its state-of-the-art technology, security, and scalability. Whether you are a startup or an established enterprise, Wallester delivers flexible, reliable solutions tailored to meet the evolving needs of the digital economy.
Job DescriptionWe are seeking a strategic and well-connected Influencer Marketing Manager to lead Wallester‚Äôs influencer and thought leadership outreach in the B2B fintech space. In this role, you will identify and collaborate with key voices in fintech, business, finance, and affiliate ecosystems to increase brand authority, visibility, and demand generation through trusted third-party promotion.
Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and execute an influencer marketing strategy tailored to B2B finance/fintech audiences (e.g. startups, CFOs, affiliate partners, neobanks, payment platforms).This includes collaborations with our core client segments such as media buying agencies, e-commerce businesses, travel agencies, and other relevant verticals.Identify and engage with relevant industry influencers, such as fintech bloggers, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn thought leaders, podcast hosts, and event speakers.Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with external creators and KOLs (key opinion leaders).Collaborate with internal teams (content, performance, affiliate) to align messaging and campaigns.Manage contract negotiations, briefing, and content approval processes.Track and report on influencer campaign performance, with a focus on brand awareness, lead quality, and engagement.Own Wallester‚Äôs influencer CRM, campaign calendar, and performance dashboard.
RequirementsMust-Have:2‚Äì4 years of experience in influencer marketing, partnerships, or B2B marketing.Strong knowledge of YouTube, followed by META platforms, LinkedIn, Twitter/X and fintech media ecosystems.Proven ability to identify and collaborate with influencers and thought leaders in B2B environments.Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.Strategic mindset with understanding of how influencer campaigns support business goals like lead generation, partner acquisition, and brand trust.Proficiency with tracking tools, UTM tagging, and influencer platforms (e.g., Upfluence, BuzzSumo, or manual CRM).Languages: Fluent English is required. Proficiency in Russian, Spanish, French, or German is a plus.Nice-to-Have:Experience in fintech, SaaS, or financial services.Existing network of fintech content creators and/or affiliate experts.Experience with multi-language or multi-market campaigns in Europe.Knowledge of financial regulations for promotional content, such as disclosure requirements.
Company offers:Competitive salaryCareer opportunitiesSupportive and caring LeadershipA chance to work as part of a highly motivated and talented teamTeam building and Company Events

jobs.title: Freelance SEO Expert
jobs.description:
An SEO specialist is required to optimize a new website for a health and wellness provider in Austin, Texas. The website, currently in development and set to launch within the next month, needs to be search-engine ready from the outset. The focus will be on building a strong SEO foundation during the development phase, followed by ongoing optimization and strategy to grow online visibility and attract new clients. This is a remote position suited for a professional who can deliver both technical SEO setup and long-term performance improvements.
DeliverablesConduct keyword research tailored to manual lymphatic drainage services and the Austin, Texas market.Provide SEO guidance during the site‚Äôs development to ensure proper on-page and technical setup.Optimize meta tags, headings, alt text, and site architecture for maximum search performance.Implement local SEO strategies to enhance visibility within Austin and surrounding areas.Support setup of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and other tracking tools.Deliver an SEO roadmap and best practices guide for launch readiness.Provide ongoing SEO support post-launch, including monitoring, reporting, and continuous optimization.
RequirementsDemonstrated experience in SEO, particularly for service-based local businesses.Strong understanding of on-page, technical, and off-page SEO strategies.Proven ability to optimize websites during the build phase to avoid post-launch issues.Familiarity with local SEO practices, including Google Business Profile optimization.Proficiency with SEO tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, Moz, or Screaming Frog.Experience with WordPress or other CMS platforms is highly desirable.Strong communication skills to provide clear recommendations and updates.Availability to collaborate remotely and provide continued support after site launch.
About TwineTwine is a leading freelance marketplace connecting top freelancers, consultants, and contractors with companies needing creative and tech expertise. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and innovative startups alike, Twine enables companies to scale their teams globally.
Our MissionTwine's mission is to empower creators and businesses to thrive in an AI-driven, freelance-first world.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
We provide the DevOps automation platform built to empower developers. From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.

ü§© Why is your role important?

As Qovery‚Äôs first Product Marketing Manager, you will lay the foundation for how our story is told to the world. You‚Äôll shape the way we position ourselves in a crowded DevOps and cloud market, crafting messaging that cuts through the noise and resonates with both developers and business buyers. This role is pivotal in giving clarity to our narrative, enabling the sales team, and helping our users understand the real value of choosing Qovery.

üöÄ What will your job look like

As our first Product Marketing Manager, you‚Äôll be both strategist and builder. Your mission will be to:

Define positioning and messaging that makes Qovery‚Äôs value clear to developers, platform teams, and business stakeholders. Enable our sales team with the right tools (battlecards, one-pagers, pitch decks) to communicate our story with clarity and impact. Shape our go-to-market strategy for new features and product launches, ensuring we stand out in a crowded DevOps/CloudOps market. Collaborate with Product and Engineering to translate complex technology into simple, compelling narratives. Lead market research and competitive analysis to keep us ahead of industry trends and sharpen our differentiation. Support demand generation with content and campaigns that attract and educate prospects. Embody Qovery‚Äôs Culture: Collaborate in a caring, transparent, and innovative environment, building authentic relationships with customers and colleagues.

This is a role for someone who thrives in an early-stage environment: you‚Äôll have freedom to experiment, influence strategy directly, and set the standards for Product Marketing at Qovery.

üí° About you

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is equal parts storyteller and strategist. Someone who can dive deep into our product, empathise with developers and platform teams, and translate technical complexity into messages that resonate.

Here‚Äôs What Will Help You Succeed

At least 5 years experience as a Product Marketing Manager in B2B SaaS in early-stage startups.Experience in DevOps, Cloud, Platform Engineering, or a technical developer-focused product. A builder‚Äôs mindset: you‚Äôve shaped Product Marketing in a growing company before, or you‚Äôre eager to take on that challenge for the first time. Strong communication skills: you can switch seamlessly between writing clear, concise copy and building narratives for executives, customers, and sales teams. Analytical and curious: you like to dig into customer insights, market research, and data to inform positioning and strategy. Collaborative by nature: you work well with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, and know how to bridge technical and commercial worlds. Hands-on and proactive: in a small team, you‚Äôre comfortable rolling up your sleeves and making things happen.

Most importantly, you share our values: ownership, transparency, and a developer-first mindset.

üéØ What You‚Äôll Get at Qovery

Competitive Compensation.Comprehensive Benefits.Flexible Work Setup: Remote-first culture; work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.Learning Opportunities: Professional development and growth supported from day one.Innovative Environment: Join a high-growth startup pushing boundaries in cloud technology.Authentic Culture: Collaborate with a team that values care, innovation, and customer success.

üí• Our Talent Acquisition Process

We‚Äôve designed a streamlined process to ensure a great candidate experience. Typically, it takes 3-4 weeks:

Initial Call: Meet with Marie or Ludwig to discuss your experience, motivation, and career goals.Hiring Manager Interview: A 60-minute deep dive into your sales skills and collaboration experience.Workshop/Case Study PresentationFinal Round: Meet with a co-founder and leadership to discuss alignment with Qovery‚Äôs values and mission.Reference Checks: Validate performance, integrity, and alignment with our needs.

Please note that at this point we're only considering candidates based in France or relocating to France.

We‚Äôre committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

jobs.title: CEO Content Creator
jobs.description:
We‚Äôre looking for a CEO Content Creator to help supercharge the voice of Plytix‚Äôs CEO across digital channels. This role is part researcher, part ghostwriter, and part content strategist. You‚Äôll be working directly with the CEO to turn raw insights, notes, and ideas into polished content for X, Substack, and LinkedIn. From fact-checking trends to shaping narratives to managing the publishing process, you‚Äôll make sure the CEO‚Äôs voice is sharp, consistent, and influential.
What is Plytix?
Plytix is the world‚Äôs leading Product Information Management (PIM) platform for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Plytix PIM helps companies store and organize product information ranging from descriptions and images to prices, and other specifications, in one place. Essentially, it‚Äôs a handy tool that makes managing and updating product data a whole lot easier.
About our culture
We‚Äôre not big on corporate jargon, so we‚Äôll keep it real. We‚Äôre a diverse team spread across the world, working together to build great software while enjoying the ride. We‚Äôve been recognized as one of the best places to work in Spain by Great Place to Work¬Æ - 3 years in a row, but who‚Äôs counting ;)
Plytix is no typical company, watch this video, and if you like what you see, keep scrolling.
What‚Äôs the opportunity?
This is your chance to work side-by-side with a founder-CEO who‚Äôs building thought leadership in ecommerce, SaaS, and AI. You‚Äôll have a front-row seat to the conversations, insights, and predictions shaping the future of these industries‚Äîand you‚Äôll be the one turning those into engaging content that reaches thousands of readers and followers globally.
From research-driven Substack articles to bite-sized X threads and sharp LinkedIn posts, you‚Äôll help amplify the CEO‚Äôs voice and build his reputation as a thought leader. If you‚Äôre someone who loves storytelling, thrives on digging into new ideas, and can balance creativity with precision, this role gives you the perfect mix of autonomy, creativity, and impact.

What will you be doing?
Researching and fact-checking industry trends, news, and insights to support the CEO‚Äôs content.Ghostwriting articles, posts, and threads in the CEO‚Äôs voice for Substack, LinkedIn, and X.Managing the editorial calendar for the CEO‚Äôs content channels.Collaborating with the CEO to brainstorm and refine narratives and storylines.Publishing, monitoring, and iterating content to grow reach and engagement.Ensuring consistency of tone, accuracy of information, and alignment with Plytix‚Äôs brand values.

After 1 month:You‚Äôll have a strong grasp of the CEO‚Äôs tone of voice, favorite topics, and how he likes to communicate. You‚Äôll have already supported in drafting and publishing a few LinkedIn or X posts, and you‚Äôll have a content calendar mapped out.
After 3 months:You‚Äôll be confidently ghostwriting and publishing across multiple channels. The CEO‚Äôs content will start showing measurable growth in reach and engagement. You‚Äôll be known internally as the right hand for anything related to CEO thought leadership.
6 months in:You‚Äôll have fully taken ownership of the CEO‚Äôs content ecosystem. The Substack will be running smoothly with consistent articles, social channels will be growing steadily, and the CEO‚Äôs voice will be a recognizable one in SaaS and ecommerce circles. By this point, you won‚Äôt just be producing content‚Äîyou‚Äôll be shaping a thought leadership brand.
Who will you be working with?
You‚Äôll work directly with the CEO, collaborating closely on ideas and narratives. You‚Äôll also interact with the Marketing team to align messaging and ensure the CEO‚Äôs voice complements Plytix‚Äôs broader brand strategy.
Need to have:
5+ years of experience in content writing, journalism, ghostwriting, or copywriting.Exceptional English writing and editing skills.Ability to adapt tone of voice and write as if you are the CEO.Strong research and fact-checking skills.Experience managing and publishing on platforms like Substack, LinkedIn, and X.A portfolio showing long-form and short-form content across digital platforms.
Nice to have
Background in B2B SaaS, ecommerce, or retail.Experience working directly with executives or founders on personal branding.Knowledge of SEO and content analytics.A natural curiosity for AI, SaaS, and the future of commerce.A dog üê∂ (dogs are the best).
To apply:
Easy apply on LinkedIn and send us your video presentation via email to hr@plytix.comVideo presentation: for an explanation of the video requirement see this video üëâüèº https://youtu.be/XgLelH6eIkc?si=p94LmMtktZOirsuH

Why work at Plytix
Voted one of the top best workplaces by Great Place to Work¬ÆBe a part of a welcoming culture with bright, friendly people from around the worldHave a purpose and plenty of opportunities to grow from day oneWork from home or from our offices in the center of MalagaDon‚Äôt work on your birthday‚Äîenjoy an extra day of paid time offEnjoy free catered lunches and unlimited ice cream when working from the office in MalagaCompetitive full-time salaryPrivate health insurance covered by PlytixGym discountFactorial Flexible Retribution (Restaurant, Transport & Nursery Vouchers)And more!

About our culture
PLYTIX is a company committed to diversity and equality. Therefore, all our selection processes guarantee equal opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, origin, nationality, age, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.
We are committed to managing your personal information with care and in accordance with our privacy policy. To learn more about how we handle your data, please click HERE.

jobs.title: Spontaneous Application
jobs.description:
OUR STORY:

üá™üá∫ Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !

Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.

Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.

With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing ‚Ç¨3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.

Every day, thanks to our rich catalog of products and services (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves 38,000 private and public sector clients, from Photoroom to Mistral AI, Golem AI, and ADEME.

üìç Our offices are located in Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Bordeaux, Rouen, Rennes and Lyon.

At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.

All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.

We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.

jobs.title: Director - User Acquisition
jobs.description:
With 100+ bn minutes streamed annually, 120 minutes of daily average listening time, and 6+ billion total audio plays on our platform, Pocket FM is on a mission to build the world‚Äôs largest AI-powered audio streaming platform. Rapidly growing in the US and India, with strong momentum in Europe and LATAM, we are redefining how stories are created, owned, and consumed.
What sets us apart? We‚Äôre an AI-first company, leveraging cutting-edge generative AI to transform every part of our ecosystem‚Äîfrom content creation and language localization to marketing, distribution, and monetization. Our in-house AI has already powered 10% of US revenue and is listening through original, AI-generated audio series. We‚Äôre also expanding into new storytelling formats like comics and web novels, all built on the foundation of our proprietary AI platforms.
You can get more updates, insights and everything behind the scenes at Pocket FM here - https://xtra.pocketfm.com/
What is the role?Goal is to scale and optimise spends across external digital marketing channels:New User AcquisitionReducing existing user churnRe-activation of Lapsed Users
You‚Äôll own user acquisition for the region, and build the playbooks that will define how we grow, monetize, and retain users in one of our most complex markets.
What needs to be solved?Strategy: Marketing channel strategyEvaluate channel/ campaign performance working with the analytics and business teamsExperiment new channels and new products from existing partnersBabysit and manage the life cycle of UA campaigns from Acquisition to Retention via different channelsManage and drive monthly ad spends, balancing performance with stakeholder expectations. A key part of this is to work closely with studios and business team to align UA strategy with product A/B testing, maintaining a strong creative/playable pipeline and leveraging data analysis to drive continuous growth. Run A/B tests on creatives, campaigns and audiencesBuild direct publisher/ network relationships where helpful and run pilot campaigns to test feasibilityTest, launch and scale digital lead generation through programmatic buying
Execution: Marketing operationsCampaign execution. Design, set up, and optimize campaigns to drive high-quality, cost-effective app installs -tracking and improving core KPIs like CPI, ROAS, Retention, and LTVCoordinating with the creative/ production team to launch quirky, audience centric creatives/ promosWorking with the third party agency to get all integrations completed and doing periodic campaign performance reviews. Identify and reduce fraud and misattribution across channelsAgency/ partner management
Enablers: Ensure enablement and maintenance of tracking tags across various client apps and websiteReport campaign performance weekly to the business team, forecast monthly response volume and budgets
What We‚Äôre Looking For7-10 years of experience with strong understanding of consumer funnel, consumer cohorts and targeting; scaling consumer tech or gaming companiesMedia understanding is a primary need. Experience of working with external agencies ‚Äì Creative Agencies, Media Partners, Research Partners etc We are looking for data driven people who enjoy solving complex problems through analytical excellence and commercial acumen. Deep experience with attribution models, funnel analysis, ROI/LTV frameworksVery strong understanding of digital tools across search. performance, social media, reach platforms and where to use what Ability to judge creative assets both from a brand strategy as well as aesthetic sense Experience of working across the complete marketing mix i.e, new product launches, communication, revenue management, packaging developmentSharp understanding of creative strategy and the ability to scale high-performing assetsAn experiment-first mindset: bias for action, willingness to test, learn, and pivot quicklyHands-on operator - comfortable moving between strategy and execution

jobs.description:
About Us

Are you passionate about digital marketing and eager to make a real impact in the world of e-commerce?

Join our team and help grow a successful online store through smart content strategies, performance marketing, and data-driven insights ‚Äî all from our office in Burgas.

Please note: This is an on-site position based in Burgas.

Main duties and responsibilities

Plan and execute digital strategies to boost traffic, conversions, and overall online store performance

Launch and manage monthly paid advertising campaigns (Google, Meta, etc.)

Prepare and send regular newsletters and promotional emails to segmented audiences

Optimize product content and user experience across the site

Monitor and analyze campaign performance and suggest improvements

Collaborate with the e-commerce and sales teams to align marketing with business goals

Requirements

Experience or strong interest in e-commerce and online sales channels

Knowledge of SEO, SEM, content marketing, and performance tracking

Fluency in English (written and spoken)

Hands-on experience with digital tools: Google Analytics, Google Ads, Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager, Meta Ads Manager, Facebook Business Manager

Analytical thinking and curiosity about marketing automation and e-commerce trends

What we offer

Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses

A stable, full-time position in our Burgas office

Ongoing training and professional development opportunities

Supportive work culture, health insurance, and social benefits

Ready to take your next step in digital marketing ‚Äî and see the results directly impact an online business?

Apply now and join our growing e-commerce team in Burgas!
